website_summaries.verdict: This bargain heat gun offers consistently high temperatures and decent control for detailed work.
pros: Nozzle attachments are better quality than expected in a heat gun for below $30
Precise directional nozzle is a big help with tasks from paint removal to shaping plastic
cons: Its lifespan can be fairly short, but for occasional tasks, users are happy with this unit
Takes a few minutes to reach highest heat setting

customer_reviews.title: Really good heating gun
customer_reviews.text: *UPDATE* owned this heat gun since July 2017, it’s now June 2019 and it works perfectly,using it for many art projects* This following is my original review.* I've been wanting one of these for small projects and this worked perfectly. My wife found a used baby cart that was pretty scratched up and this gun did a perfect job of restoring it (Pictures attached). Next I'm going to use it on the scratch marks on the plastic door panels in my car. A little heat and the dings just melt away. Mine shipped very quickly and I am extremely happy with my new heat gun.
customer_reviews.author: Jami

customer_reviews.title: This + WD-40 + plastic knife = bumper sticker removal.
customer_reviews.text: I read a review here before buying it that it helped them remove old bumper stickers. Well, it does! (with some chemical help and a plastic knife) My stickers were nearly 10 years old and this gun made it so easy to get them off. I plan to use it for other projects and crafts, but it gave my car new life. It even works on glass! If you're in my situation, don't hesitate and get it!
customer_reviews.author: Max Schmer

customer_reviews.title: Did a good job
customer_reviews.text: Worked for what I used it for. I made a “fake” fireplace with cardboard boxes and polystyrene. I used the heat gun to melt the polysterene bricks to make it look more like the rough texture of brick. The heat gun in a video I watched worked better. I used the higher setting and had to move it over one brick a few times. But I was happy with the results
customer_reviews.author: Imre Krugel

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for kayak repairs!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for kayak repair and some simple work with kydex. The attachments work nice for directing air flow and other than the chord not being as long as I would like this heat gun is great for the average household. I've never heard of Genesis before so I can't speak to the reliability of the brand but the fit and finish of this product seem solid and I expect it will last for many years.
customer_reviews.author: ____Top Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool. Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tool. Cheap, ridiculously hot and the nozzle attachments give it the extra versatility I needed to heat shrink electrical connections without melting the surrounding countryside. I really like the fact that it can safely stand up on end with the nozzle pointing straight up. That frees both of your hands to manipulate whatever it is you are treating with the heat gun.
customer_reviews.author: MoneyPitTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Gets Dangerously Hot
customer_reviews.text: I have worked with heat guns before, I have owned a few different styles and brands at this point. This heat gun no matter how careful you are melts cosmetic grade plastic even at the lowest temperature and even at 14 plus inches distance. I got a 2nd degree burn on the palm of my hands while moving products 5 minutes after shrink wrapping. I decided not to sell the products because I am not sure if the heat decreased the effect of the preservative and do not want any problems nor my reputation ruined. I not only wasted my money buying this product but also a lot of money worth of awesome ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: Danay C

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT HEAT GUN
customer_reviews.text: For the money you cannot find a better heat gun. I purchased this unit to replace a much more expensive heat gun that did not work as well as this one. Heats up fast and gets extremely hot. The In included tips fit on the gun extremely well.
customer_reviews.author: J. Marx

customer_reviews.title: LITE ON FIRE!!!
customer_reviews.text: This gun light on fire and ruined a $50 tint kit I ordered from amazon. I've had heat guns before and never a problem. All I did was plug this gun in and turn it on. Smoked for 2 seconds and before I could turn it off and unplug it a flame shot out of the tip ruining the tint.. spend some extra money and buy a better gun..
customer_reviews.author: James B.

customer_reviews.title: Does What I Need
customer_reviews.text: The heat gun works. Sure it feels lightweight and cheap, but you get what you pay for. I mainly bought this item to use on heat shrink tubing. I was tired of using a lighter to do the same job. The item arrived in a cardboard box and did not appear to have been opened or used in the past. Previous reviews noted that this heat gun smokes a lot with first use. I ran it on full blast for several minutes outside in order to break it in. I did not notice any weird smells or smoke. Maybe they fixed that issue? It works great for now for my intended use. We'll see how long it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Worst Hairdryer EVER! My Eyebrows Were Left Smoking!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously though, it works well. Doesn't overheat easily, as some have said. Attachments are basic, but so was the price. I am only using it for quick material softening and the occasional label renoval. I would probably invest in something a little more heavy duty if I had to use it all the time; but for projects and occasional heavier tasks, I think it's just fine.
customer_reviews.author: JarheddTop Contributor: Golf

customer_reviews.title: Must have if you do any heat-shrink project
customer_reviews.text: This was bought for my home theater system refresh project. I was running new speaker cables and other audio cables with new connectors and also cable sleeving. Heat shrink tubings were used at numerous areas, and this heat gun with multiple directional attachments helped tremendously and made the project went quite smoothly. I particularly like the 2 heat settings, as some finer areas require less intense heat. Also, the heat gun can rest on its rear end, i.e. with the heat nozzle pointing upward. The rear is sort of flat, and with the heat gun steadily rested, it allows both of my hands to handle the cable/wire and rotating them by the heat source. Very thoughtful design.
customer_reviews.author: John Y.

customer_reviews.title: HUGE bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant about buying this heat gun initially because the price was so low but after reading several positive reviews I decided to give it a shot. Extremely glad I did. This heat gun is on par with guns that cost 4 to 5 times as much. There's a faint burning smell when first used (like all heat guns) but that burns off in a minute or so of use. I've used it several times on various projects and haven't run into any issues. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Was great at first, but didn't hold up
customer_reviews.text: This heat gun worked great for a couple of weeks. Then it melted and parts fell off while using it. It's probably fine for occasional, light use. But I needed a heat gun that I could use every day in my candle making business. I wasn't expecting the whole front end of the gun to melt and come apart while smoothing the surface of a batch of candles. When I turned off the gun and checked, the plastic around the metal had melted and warped, which allowed part of the plastic cover and some type of metal ring to fall off the gun.
customer_reviews.author: CaroleO

customer_reviews.title: You get what u pay for!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great the first time i used in April 2020. But went to use again in June 2020 and it does not work. It does not turn on.
customer_reviews.author: Reeseanb

customer_reviews.title: Very useful!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe I've not had one of these before now! I've found so many uses for it and I've been able complete projects that have been sitting idle for a long time. The two heat settings are useful and you'll be surprised how frequently you use the lower setting as it is more than adequate for most tasks. I was even able to use it to remove Rhino Lining from my bumper! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Toughtoy4x4

customer_reviews.title: It seems to be a good product overall
customer_reviews.text: It seems to be a good product overall, perhaps mine was just an off case. Used it a couple of times and twice it rejected to be turned on after some use. If you shake it while heating a workpiece, you sometimes can hear the fun stops for a fraction of a second. Looks like a lose electric contact or something. As for others' complains about smoke during the initial use: that's every heat gun. Small pieces of oil and plastic shavings will need to burn out. Nothing to worry about ;)
customer_reviews.author: Cos

customer_reviews.title: CAUGHT ON FIRE
customer_reviews.text: First time using it, it started smoking in the front and back. Several hours later we tried it again and IT CAUGHT ON FIRE!! WTH. Such a big waste of freaking money! This was for my small business, too. Oh and only the small circular attachment fits, none of the others fit. Horrible, horrible product. If I could rate it with no stars I would! UPDATE! I called Amazon customer service, told them it caught on fire, in my house & with my baby in the house. They issued a refund for the whole amount and told me to throw it away. So happy they issued a refund as I saw other reviews saying they wouldn’t allow it.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Is it supposed to smoke while it’s off?
customer_reviews.text: The first time I plugged it in to use, the heat and fan worked fine. But then I noticed some smoke coming out the back of the gun—even when it was switched off but still plugged in. I’m going to send it back. But be careful with this gun. Test it carefully and do not to leave it plugged in while not in use. It could start a fire.
customer_reviews.author: TT

customer_reviews.title: It gets hot like it should.
customer_reviews.text: It's a heat gun. I use it for shrink tubing, thermoplastic and wax candles. I mainly use the low setting and it already gets quite hot. I'll switch to the high setting for the wax candles that have already been made and if they've pulled away from the sides of the glass. I start at the bottom and work my way up in a spiral fashion to get it even out. It's been great so far and I hope it doesn't smoke like in other reviews.
customer_reviews.author: AnAmazonHome

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Removes all my stubborn hard to remove labels from my amazon shipping boxes, bottles, containers, etc. This Genesis heat gun works great and has two settings.(High & Low). If after removing the labels you still have some glue stickiness residue, I remove it easily with a drop of Goo Gone for fast removal. It also comes with some attachments to intensify the disbursement of heat, but never really have a need to use them. The only big issue I have, is it does not come with a mini stand or hook to place it in as the metal tip of gun is extremely hot when you are done and cannot put it on anything that may burn or catch fire.
customer_reviews.author: Jor El

customer_reviews.title: Excellent heat gun. Great value for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very good heat gun. However I underestimated the size of the product. I was expecting something smaller like a hot glue gun but this is the size of a very big hair dryer (not the size of those compact portable hair dryers). It works well but if you're using it in applications with small electronics and you need flexibility of heating a small area, this might not be the right one for you. They include an attachment to narrow the nozzle but the heating area is still larger than expected from the pictures.
customer_reviews.author: KS Review

customer_reviews.title: Didnt burn my house down
customer_reviews.text: This is a VERY cheaply made product but did work ok for the one job I needed it for (to warm and bend a piece of hard plastic) which was about the same as this is made of. The parts,nozzel etc dont line up in case properly on mine. Production line screw up perhaps? But hey price was cheap so I didnt expect it to be high quality. It worked, I cant bitch. But if you need one to use awhile look elsewhere and buy a better one this one may be a fire hazard due to shoddy assembly.
customer_reviews.author: Trisha S

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: When it arrived, it was in perfect condition. I wanted to get this as a birthday gift for my father, saying that he is a project-manager and loves to do construction and building things at home, I thought that he would like this! My thoughts were right. The package was perfect, and looked exactly like the picture. The only reason why I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 was because it gave off a chemically smell, but overall it worked perfectly and definitely worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor G.

customer_reviews.title: Nice heat gun.
customer_reviews.text: This heat gun definitely puts out a lot of heat, enough to fry your fingers if you're not careful. However I was a little disappointed in the fan motor speed as it doesn't blow out with very much pressure. I would recommend to anyone after use, let the heat guns metal nozzle cool off as it will burn or melt anything it touches for the first 5 minutes. I like the nozzle attachments and the quality of the outside of the gun it's pretty nice. Definitely does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg

customer_reviews.title: Plastic near nozzle melting
customer_reviews.text: This heat gun worked great for the first and second use, but after using it for only a minute or two at a time and then turning it off in between uses, the plastic around the nozzle has started melting. The black ring no longer clips into place because the notches that secure it have been warped by melting. Wearing gloves while using is a MUST. I don't know what has caused the melting since it has only light use so far. I'm concerned that it is not safe to use if the plastic casing can't withstand the temperature.
customer_reviews.author: A. Mason

customer_reviews.title: Generic feel, but decent quality.
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about this gun due to the generic quality of it, but after using it a few times, I stand corrected. The heat output is great. I purchased it to help loosen the glue on a cell phone front glass and it worked perfectly. I have since used this on heat shrink for wires and window tint.
customer_reviews.author: ICED

customer_reviews.title: Works well, easily does the jobs at home.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and does the job. Sure, it's not for "intensive all-day-long" shop, but for your garage, it is plenty !!! I mostly use the lower setting and the high setting is a scorcher - to me the lower setting has been enough. The on/off rocker switch feels too much cheap so I'm pretty sure it's the first thing that will bust... Yup, I still recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: alexdelara

customer_reviews.title: Dead on second use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this several months ago - I can't contact seller or see date anymore. I used it once and it worked perfectly. I just went to use it again and it's dead. I'd like to get a refund or replacement, but don't have that option now.
customer_reviews.author: FrequentBuyer

customer_reviews.title: I really like this heat gun
customer_reviews.text: I really like this heat gun. I search for a while before I bought one. I use this when making chocolate truffles to give a burst of heat to my colored cocoa powder and to heat up my air gun just a bit. It also works well to heat my molds up for any left over chocolate. I have not used any of the attachments so I dont know about them. (they seamed kind of cheep) I did not buy this for the attachments so I my review does not reflect that part. Also, I love that this has two heat settings.
customer_reviews.author: CCOTop Contributor: Nail Art

customer_reviews.title: Concern due to a lot of smoke
customer_reviews.text: When I went to use it a lot of smoke came out so I turned off right away and took outside, I haven't plugged it in again. I read through instructions and went to web site but I don't see any mention of this. If it's normal it should be listed in the instructions. The price and features were what I was looking for. It may be normal but it's below 0 with the windchill, so I don't feel like burning off the smoke outside. This was actually smoke coming out the back of the gun, not just an odor from using a new tool. They include a number to call but naturally it's a weekend when this happened.
customer_reviews.author: Ros

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS. First time use I turned it on and the inside caught on fire smoke was so bad set the smoke detectors off in my house. Very dangerous. I called the company and they do not care. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Old School Thinking

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted one month
customer_reviews.text: This heat gun worked great for my candles but it only worked for 1 month before it stopped blowing and the whole thing started smoking. Of course it stopped working right after my 30 day return window so no refund. Very disappointed that this only lasted for one batch of candles and I already need a new one. would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For the price, excellent heat gun
customer_reviews.text: What originally had me choose this particular tool was while reading reviews before I bought the tool someone gave it a one star complaining it was too hot. Since I needed a heating tool that put out plenty of heat, and knowing it came with directional fittings and also knowing that the distance between the piece I’d be working on and the heater would be up to me I was sold. I’ll just remember not to dry my hair with it..
customer_reviews.author: jax

customer_reviews.title: Melted after only a few uses
customer_reviews.text: I probably got a defective unit. After a few uses, the black plastic shield covering the barrel of the heat gun fell off. The plastic underneath is completely melted. The heat gun got extremely hot all the way up to barrel to the trigger and you could smell melting plastic. I would not recommend except for the latest of heat gun duties. I was using both low and high heat blasts of 30 - 60 seconds on pieces 10 pieces of glass I was attempting to get the remaining wax out of. Buy a better quality gun if you're going to use it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: robert moy

customer_reviews.title: Easy and great value
customer_reviews.text: I used this to heat poly pipe so that it would stretch over fittings for an underground sprinkler system. Saved my marriage as my wife was getting tired of finding dirt and insects in her hair dryer. The heat gun is much faster, too. Other fun uses: *kicking up chiminea or fire pit fires a notch when they start to die down. *getting a good hot flame going when heating wood chips or pellets (like in the A-maze-n pellet smoker) for smoking meat
customer_reviews.author: Sport303

customer_reviews.title: Save your oven, bake your headlights in a box with this.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this knowing it is on the cheap end (in fact I got an open box one for $10) but it has performed as needed so far. I bought to use on various art/foam projects and shrink tubing on electronics but I found the best use possible. For people who customize their headlights and need to bake them open and people freak out when you want to use the stove, this has worked perfectly so far.
customer_reviews.author: BKC

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: It's definitely not the best one out there and doesn't feel like it's the sturdiest tool out there. However for the price I think it's great gets very hot and does the occasional job well. If this is a tool that you will be using alot or in harsh environments I would recommend looking in a higher tier. But for me personally I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Erek Campanelli

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: I didnt even use this thing for a whole minute. I noticed immediately when I changed it from on to off that there was a little flicker of electricity behind the switch. I was like eh.. doesnt seem right, but let's see if it's any good ( stupid on my part ) well I hadnt even had it on for a full minute before it started smoking out of the back. Just avoid this guys. This is extremely dangerous
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Good source of heat for repairs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this heat gun to take out wrinkles on used Allen Edmonds shoes that I purchased on Ebay. I hd been using and iron and a damp cloth but that takes polish off the show and creates minor issues on light color shoes that I woud rather not deal with. This heat gun takes out wrinkles quickly with no discoloration from moisture and no ill effects(as long as you keep the heat moving and don't stay too long on one area). This was an excellent purchase for my needs. Feels sturdy. Works well.
customer_reviews.author: Rommel Upshur

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product with a amazing price!
customer_reviews.text: A amazing Product for all your needs! Works great for tough projects like fixing a dent in a car or just cellophane wrapping a box! I can't believe that I paid such a great price for it! I am Very Happy 😊! ✔💸💸💣👀
customer_reviews.author: Robert C. Messina

customer_reviews.title: Wow - this work great and great value!
customer_reviews.text: I don't have much experience with heat guns and bought this for a vinyl wrap application on a bike. It heats quickly, seems to maintain the heat well, as far as I could tell. The different nozzles feel a bit light, but I found one I liked and it stayed in place while I did my project. I suggest checking the heat rating as this was at the top end of my needs. I didn't do so, and was fortunate that the low setting worked ok. Well built, great value, highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool... multiple uses.
customer_reviews.text: Love this tool. I was skeptical whether to or not buy this as hair dryer was good enough for my projects. Since the day I bought it till today I have done more projects than I have done all these years. Nothing bad for the price and function. Until I bought it I never expected I will be needing this. Have not been long but so far it worked
customer_reviews.author: Prasad

customer_reviews.title: Works great, Good buy.
customer_reviews.text: This is very handy for removing adhesives. I had 2 project, one to remove the caulk around the tub from the previous owner putting it too thick and mold got underneath. The 2nd time I used it, was to reverse a doggie door on a French door to lower the rise. The insert had been sealed with a silicone adhesive and softened right up and I even reused the adhesive as it stayed put. Gun works great, several attachments included and a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: AussiegirlIngridTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: 45 years plus experience as a mechanic. This item is a dangerous piece of junk. It literally caught fire in my hand. Lucky I was wearing heavy duty leather gloves and I was not injured. The unit was on less than 30 sec when it caught fire.
customer_reviews.author: Steven W. Metz

customer_reviews.title: Genesis GHG1500A Heat Gun
customer_reviews.text: First time buying and using a heat gun. Particularly like that it has two heat settings and comes with different nozzle attachments. Product received was exactly as advertised. Used it to apply heat shrinking wire connecters containing solder. Heat gun worked perfectly. Also received product one day ahead of promised delivery date.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Kimbrell

customer_reviews.title: Great tool! Great price 👍
customer_reviews.text: Great tool! The only thing I didnt care for was the toggle high and low switch. I found myself turning it to high/low when trying to turn it off. The off switch is in the middle of the high and low switch. Other than that, it works great. I've used it to remove stickers/vinyl letter from the dealership left on our vehicles and apply vinyl wrap to my SUV.
customer_reviews.author: SLC Prime Member

customer_reviews.title: Does the joib
customer_reviews.text: Listened to the reviewers before me and worked it outside for 15 min until the smokes go away. No smell or smoke now. And yes gives a lot of smoke. Identical to harborfreight one but has additional scrapers which are rather flimsy. Does the job for me. No reason to spend too much money on heat guns since they are like toasters, over time lose effectiveness or burn out. Just some wires and a fan. Treat it as disposable, get the cheapest you can find.
customer_reviews.author: Tex

customer_reviews.title: no packaging
customer_reviews.text: item was delivered just by the product box and no other packaging. two(2) amazon prime tapes were place where box can be opened but the tapes barely stick with the box. you can even pill off the tape by just blowing it out. did not really stick at all. thankfully item was not damage and works perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Neil_Vals

customer_reviews.title: Perfect heat gun.
customer_reviews.text: Drys paint well, shrink wraps the heat shrink wire covers, melts glue and plastic. Gets damn hot. Just make sure the switch is off before plugging in. The off is the middle setting on the switch which isn’t ideal to me but a minor issue.
customer_reviews.author: GTWR60000

customer_reviews.title: Mine was defective 😩
customer_reviews.text: I got this and out of the box I connected it to try it and it started smoking and had a bad smell- like burned plastic so it was returned. Beautiful machine and the attachments were nice too but mine was defective. I bought another brand. Just sharing my experience maybe if you buy it is good to you...
customer_reviews.author: Zmiami

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended...
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this heat gun does a great job. In the first week, I have already used it to remove caulk, soften the adhesive for the foam sound barrier on my car door panel and even used it to finish broiling the pork skin on my "siu yoke" recipe! :) Be careful when using the high setting on this unit as it really gets extremely hot. Highly recommend this unit...
customer_reviews.author: Ratatouille

customer_reviews.title: WOW was that frightening
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this heat gun to shrink wrap hand crafted soap bars. I was so excited when it arrived I decided to immediately give it a try. My excitement quickly turned to fear when I first pressed the trigger for the low heat setting. An orange "flame" shot out of the gun burning the shrink wrap and soap like a flame thrower. I quickly placed the gun on the counter where one more orange flame shot out and thick smoke appeared. I unplugged the gun and it continued to smoke for quite some time. Definitely going to return this item and I WILL NOT BE REPLACING IT WITH THE SAME ITEM.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Serves its purpose
customer_reviews.text: Serves its purpose, smokes a bit when you first turn it on, typical heat gun when its been sitting for a while coils heat up and smoke comes out nothing to call the fire Dept about. I used it to warm up my head lights and take off glue residue from head light tint... so heat and wd40 made them brand new
customer_reviews.author: YASURIS MEDINA

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I have to agree with a few of the other reviewers that said that it smokes if used for too long. I only used it to top off my homemade candles and smoke came out when I used it for more than 5 minutes or more. However, it did do what it supposed to do which was to melt the top of my candles to make them smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Sajecha

customer_reviews.title: NEVER WORKED
customer_reviews.text: Defective and not working at all. Wouldn’t even turn on. Unfortunately I didn’t use the heat gun for a couple months after I purchased it, so I could not return it. At least it didn’t catch fire like in some of the other reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Della Han

customer_reviews.title: Instantly started smoking
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on Saturday, April 21, and received it promptly Sunday afternoon, April 22. I went to use it for heat shrink tubing on my iPhone charger cord, and after being on for a mere 30 seconds, both the front and the back started smoking. I'm in a third floor apartment, and now my whole place smells like smoke and burnt chemicals. The back caught on fire soon after it started smoking, and I had to rush outside to keep from burning anything inside. I am disappointed with this purchase, to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase this product------dangerous
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product with the purpose of shrink wrapping packages. The first time I used it it started smoking and i was nervous because it was on the box it came in with smoke coming out the vents. Then i thought maybe thats the initial use of it it'll stop smoking.....no it did not and I immediately unplugged it after three uses. If you decide to continue to use I would say use with caution and never leave it alone.
customer_reviews.author: Fran Brown

customer_reviews.title: THIS Heat Gun has a Real Safety Label
customer_reviews.text: I choose this model since it has a real safety-testing agency. AND, I did verify it with that testing company. There was another similarly-priced model on Amazon that DID NOT have any third-party testing. Also, the CE-mark is worthless in North America. For a few extra $$, I feel safer using a product that's tested to North American UL/ANSI-safety standards by an independent agency.....instead of another maker's self certification CE-marking.
customer_reviews.author: John Lockyer

customer_reviews.title: It is working fine, but there is a loose piece inside the ...
customer_reviews.text: This heat gun is being used for crafts and small household projects. It is working fine, but there is a loose piece inside the gun that you can see (and hear). It doesn't appear to be affecting the operation... yet. Get super hot and works for what I need. I just hope all the pieces don't start falling out.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Great heat gun
customer_reviews.text: Great heat gun for the price. Two modes is all you really need. Heats up instantly, you do not need to wait more then 5 seconds for this heat gun to be throwing heat out. Wish it came with a little stand to place the metal end on after use but overall great product.
customer_reviews.author: StormTech

customer_reviews.title: Hot and ready
customer_reviews.text: Used this just recently and it sure puts out some heat! I ended up using it for long periods of time (10-15 minutes straight) which eventually made the gun produce some smoke, but I think that's just because I ran it on high for so long. Outside of that, it ran fine the several times I used it and I believe using it with shorter time frames, it will be just fine.
customer_reviews.author: VanderFam

customer_reviews.title: Works just as it should
customer_reviews.text: Just a lil bit of warning this heat gun heats up too fast so I would be careful. Lesson learned since my old heat gun does not provide too much heat unlike this one I stayed a lil too long on my fender when I was rolling it and almost ruin my paint.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It won’t last long.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this since February, and it’s been a great product. However I went to use it today and the only thing it’s doing is smoking. Not only am I disappointed that it only lasted not even 3 months, but the fact that it’s smoking like crazy.
customer_reviews.author: Crafty Mama

customer_reviews.title: It melted off for little over five minutes use
customer_reviews.text: It melted for little over five minutes that was on . Very unsafe !!! I do not recommend this item
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: High switch shorting
customer_reviews.text: The high setting worked on and off. Eventually it stopped working, so I took it apart to see what was happening. Turns out the high mode switch was shorting. Effectively it could be in high mode and it wouldn't be on, but it would be shorting the whole time. Very bad fire danger.
customer_reviews.author: bookert

customer_reviews.title: Amazing.
customer_reviews.text: Used to make horror dolls. Fun fact, if you spill hot wax on the floor, wave this puppy over it and ta-dah you can now wipe up the wax. Anyhow. This baby puts off some heat. Don’t hold it to close though because I caught a baby doll head on fire while working on it.
customer_reviews.author: Shopaholic

customer_reviews.title: you have to use it outside the first time so that it will stop smelling bad. After about a half hour
customer_reviews.text: As others have posted, you have to use it outside the first time so that it will stop smelling bad. After about a half hour, I moved inside because it was in the 90s and using a heat gun in that weather is awful. The smell was gone by then and I could use it inside comfortably, no problem. It's been great ever since. Very easy to use and to prop up safely when you need to put it down for adjustments on whatever project you're using it for.
customer_reviews.author: Diane H.

customer_reviews.title: Great Heat gun
customer_reviews.text: Not too much to say, this gun works well. get very hot on the highest stetting and the attachments are useful. Just wish it came with a stand as it gets very, very hot after use so you have to find a surface like concrete to rest it on to cool down. There is a bit of a burning smell with the first use but it dissipated quickly. Terrific budget heat gun.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria Ferrigno

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality!
customer_reviews.text: We had been using a low quality heat gun from Harbor Freight daily in our small business and of course it caught on fire one day. We ended up on Amazon and ordered the Genesis heat gun and you can't even compare this next to the one that caught on fire because the quality is far superior. We have a lot of tools in our business and I can tell that this will last us for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: LCF

customer_reviews.title: Nice gun.  Works well for pin stripe removal.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my 15 yr old model. You can definitely tell the quality is better on this one. I've only used it to remove a pin stripe from a new car and to loosen the glue on an iPhone battery so far. It has 2 speeds and a few attachments to help with your project.
customer_reviews.author: TTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: ... to shrink wrap over 200 soaps and it works wonderfully. I have only used the low setting as ...
customer_reviews.text: I've used this to shrink wrap over 200 soaps and it works wonderfully. I have only used the low setting as the high setting is too much for my needs. It did smoke for a bit after use the first couple times I used it, but that's normal for heat guns and doesn't last forever.
customer_reviews.author: Surreptrixus

customer_reviews.title: My Experience: Great For Causing Injury or Death
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product if you like adventure and think something like a house fire would fit the bill. It... the heat gun itself (not something it was near/leaning on) caught fire.
customer_reviews.author: Jae

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have very small hands and this heat gun is just a little too big for me. I have to say that this is an amazing product with wonderful features and attachments especially for this price point! Good customer service was able to return.
customer_reviews.author: NoniOf4

customer_reviews.title: Wow this gets hot
customer_reviews.text: If it's heat you need, it's heat you'll get. Gets hot fast. Used it on low to loosen some craft hot glue. Just had to make sure I didn't hold it too close. Probably overkill, but I plan to use it for other, more intense jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Joy Erickson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome heat gun at an incredible price!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best heat gun for the money! I love this thing! I paid $18.79. I tried to purchase a second one for my brother, but it is not available anymore here on Amazon. I hope it comes back! I use my Genesis heat gun regularly with these connectors: * Ginsco 65pcs 4 Sizes Solder Seal Heat Shrink Wire Connector Kit
customer_reviews.author: Birdman

customer_reviews.title: Workwd on initial use
customer_reviews.text: It worked on initial use to shrink vinyl wallpaper to contour to cabinets. Not sure if it is going to melt or catch fire on subsequent uses like the other reviews state. Will have to update the review later if it does. Boy! I hope not!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Mathew

customer_reviews.title: Cannot be used on high for more than a few seconds
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a lightning deal for $11, and would have been rather annoyed if I'd paid much more than that. The build quality is cheap. If used for more than ~10 seconds on the low setting, it starts to smell of plastic. On the high setting, it starts smoking after a few seconds. I did like that it came with a lot of useful attachments.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: But honey, It's a lot cheaper than a new bumper!
customer_reviews.text: I yoinked the underside of the front bumper on my BMW. I bought this to bend it back and it worked like a charm. I celebrated with a bone-in rib eye on the charcoal grill that I accelerated the fire readyness with the heat gun.
customer_reviews.author: Ancient I.T. Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great heat gun
customer_reviews.text: Great heat gun. Gets all it the bubbles out of resin fast. No need for a blow torch. Gets hot and is durable dropped it bunch and no issues.
customer_reviews.author: ANNA

customer_reviews.title: For the cost it’s awesome!
customer_reviews.text: A really really great heat gun for the money. My only complaint is that the mouthpieces get stuck on after they are heated up. Still giving the product a five out of five because for the money you cannot be it. If this review was helpful please let me know by clicking the “Helpful” button below the review.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Little Heat Gun
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little heat gun and it packs a lot of heat. I don't like to use a torch on my resin art or acrylics and this little heat gun was just what I needed. Easy to use and it came with a couple of little pieces to put on the end. I also have used it for removing sticky labels.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but a bit slow
customer_reviews.text: Note: for reflowing, I consider it an ABSOLUTE REQUIREMENT to use this heat gun together with an infrared temperature sensor. Successfully reflowed faulty solderings in the GPUs of two different laptops so far. Works well, but found that it takes almost 3 minutes (even on high setting) to reach 220 Celsius; that's a problem if you're trying to melt solder, and there are other plastic components on a PCB (that will start to melt).
customer_reviews.author: TWPenName

customer_reviews.title: Dont lick after using
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used all the different heads but it's nice to have the options. I store it back in the box, after its cooled of course, and it has no trouble going in so storage is no hassle. It gets hot quick.
customer_reviews.author: Codey G.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, got plenty hot to melt shrinkable wire covers. Has fittings that made my job even easier concentrating the heat around wires. Only improvement might be a more stable method of standing the gun on it's end when using for smaller parts or when the gun is hot and you are not using it.
customer_reviews.author: Asher

customer_reviews.title: Good kit for the money
customer_reviews.text: Ive had a few different brands of heat guns and this is on par with the quality of those as well. I really like how it included the different shields for basically the same price as other heat guns without the pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Colten G.

customer_reviews.title: I also use it for a quick top melt on my homemade soy wax candles to make sure they always have nice, smooth tops
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I needed. Trying to heat-seal product bags with a hair-dryer was making me grumpy due to wrinkling plastic and weak shrinking. This heat gun not only does the job quickly and perfectly, I also use it for a quick top melt on my homemade soy wax candles to make sure they always have nice, smooth tops. I consider this one of the best purchases I've made in recent history. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Hardly Blows
customer_reviews.text: Quite disappointed with this heat gun. On high it hardly blows any air. On low it wouldn't move a sheet of paper off a smooth table. If it wasn't so much trouble would send it back for a refund and purchase something better.
customer_reviews.author: ckie

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I had a tall, wrought iron, antique candelabra where I needed to melt all the wax off. This did a bulk of the work. There was still some residue left which I was then able to get off with SOS pads.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Miller

customer_reviews.title: Quality Heat Gun!
customer_reviews.text: I needed this to work with heat shrink for my RC hobby. So far it's been working great and I have not had any issues with smoke or strange smells coming from the gun. My favorite feature is definitely the flat back, as this allows it to sit perfectly upright and I simply lift whatever I'm working on over it (while using the curved attachment pointed away from me) and it shrinks the wrap without ever having to touch the gun! All of the attachments it comes with are really handy as well. For the price I definitely feel like I made the right choice with this one.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly well made.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, already burnt myself several times lol. , But seriously, for this price, it's a good heat gun. Heats up fast, attachments are of pretty solid metals and fit perfect, probably the best thing of all is that it't surprisingly quiet. Roommates across the hall thought a fly was trapped in a bag somewhere in their room.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: Great heat gun
customer_reviews.text: Heats up super fast. Very pleased with this purchase. First use was to heat shrink "solder & seal" connectors for a 5-conductor 24-gauge wiring job. This heat gun was a necessary tool to get the job done right!
customer_reviews.author: ebschor

customer_reviews.title: Great for foam work for cosplay
customer_reviews.text: I am a complainer, and needed something to help me with some pieces I am making, namely with foam, for forming and heat sealing. This thing has worked great so far, and I've used it for hours now.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Cleveland

customer_reviews.title: Very useful tool
customer_reviews.text: Powerful heat source for all of your needs. I do not have a factory so I do not need a commercial quality heat gun, however, this thing is amazing and very sturdy. I've used it for several types of applications and it is consistent in its heat flow as well as the volume of air it pushes. This is a very useful tool in my quiver of tools.
customer_reviews.author: A. J. Luna

customer_reviews.title: Love the stand, wish it had a cool-down mode.
customer_reviews.text: The best heat guns have a rapid-cool down feature, which this doesn't. It has the next best thing though, the ability to stand on it's head so the hot aperture is not touching anything. It would better if the aperture was closer to the ground when it is resting though instead of sticking straight up, daring your to get burned on it. Excellent heat gun in term of performance.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Tim Ambrose

customer_reviews.title: It did what I needed it to and was great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to make a costume using sintra or foamed PVC and to do so I needed a heat gun. For the price, I thought it was great and got the job done nicely. When I first turned it on there was an odd smell but that quickly dissipated and it heats up just fine without the smell.
customer_reviews.author: Don D

customer_reviews.title: Works great and comes with multiple attachments
customer_reviews.text: Comes with multiple attachments and uses to heat speed settings I used it today at my detailing business to remove a spoiler from a 3 series bmw it worked great fast and even left no residue from the 3m tape behind I highly recommend this to anyone looking for this type of product
customer_reviews.author: Brian devolve

customer_reviews.title: At $12, it's a great little gun for casual use
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little gun so far. Have used it 5 or 6 times and it has done the job excellently each time. It hasn't overheated, given off any strange smells, or crackled or whatever. I paid $12 for it and although I've only had it for about a month, would willingly buy another at that price based off of my experience up to this point. I will update my review if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: chemao

customer_reviews.title: Great heat gun
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty great heat gun, especially for the price. I've used it exclusively for heat shrink tubing so far. The lowest heat setting is plenty hot enough, and it can be easily placed flat on a bench to point straight up.
customer_reviews.author: M. Valerio

customer_reviews.title: Crafting or electrical!
customer_reviews.text: Like many tools, I am realizing that I can find many uses for the items that I buy for crafting like this heat gun. Its been great for drying paint and for doing light electrical work!
customer_reviews.author: Izzie B.

customer_reviews.title: Hotter than Margot Robbie!
customer_reviews.text: This thing gets HOT I mean! And it takes a good while to cool off. But hey, thats what it's supposed to do. Hopefully it will hold up for longer than the two year warranty. I got it on a lightning deal so I am pleased. Now lets see how long I can make it without burning myself or my house down. No joke.
customer_reviews.author: FatDogOne

product_meta.title: Genesis GHG1500A 12.5 Amp Dual-Temperature Heat Gun Kit with High and Low Settings, Air Reduction Nozzle, Reflector Nozzle, and Two Deflector Nozzles
product_meta.description:
Discover the many uses of the Genesis 1500W Dual Temperature Heat Gun.
It’s a Versatile Tool for Stripping Paint and Varnish, Softening Caulking and Putty for Removal, Removing Adhesive Labels, Thawing Pipes, Gutters, Freezers, or Radiators, Loosening Rusted Nuts and Bolts, Speed-Drying Epoxy, Cement, or any Damp Surface. 
Reach for the Genesis Heat Gun to light your charcoal grill, warm RC engines to help with starting, and so much more.. 

-Powerful 12.5 Amp Motor Delivers Heat with 1500 and 750 Watt settings. 

-Stand the Heat Gun on its back for an Integrated Stand for Convenience
-Easy to Use design can be used with a single hand

-Two Deflector Nozzles, A reflector nozzle, and Air Reduction Nozzle are Included

Simply stand the unit up on the back side with the exhaust end pointed upward to cool or as a heat gun stand while you heat shrink wire insulators. 

Make the Genesis Dual Temperature Heat Gun part of your tool set today and discover what Genesis Tools can do for you! 

The Genesis GHG1500A is UL listed and ETL Certified, and meets all product safety requirements to be sold in the United States.

Do not operate power tools in explosive atmospheres, such as in the presence of flammable liquids,gases,or dust.Power tools create sparks which may ignitethe dust or fumes
feature_bullets: 1500/750 Watt Heat Gun with Powerful 12.5 Amp Motor
High and Low Temperature Settings for Versatility
Deflector Nozzles Protect Glass and Other Surfaces.BTU Heat Rating:2500
Reflector Nozzle Speeds Thawing of Pipes. 3-position rocker type switch for high temperature, off and low temperature
Includes: (2) Deflector Nozzles, (1) Reflector Nozzle and (1) Air Reduction Nozzle
Use the Genesis Heat Gun for lighting charcoal grills without the need for smelly lighter fluid
Warm RC engines to assist with start up

specifications.Included Components: One Heat Gun with accessory attachments
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars4,869 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
